summary: This bill, the District of Columbia Board of Zoning Adjustment Home Rule Act, revises the composition of the Board of Zoning Adjustment in Washington D.C. It mandates that the Board consist solely of members appointed by the Mayor with Council consent, except when reviewing applications from foreign missions. The bill amends existing legislation to reflect this change and specifies the involvement of federal officials in cases involving foreign missions. The changes take effect 90 days after enactment.
